sailpoint.tools

Class GeneralException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • sailpoint.tools.AbstractLocalizableException
          • sailpoint.tools.GeneralException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, sailpoint.tools.Localizable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccountGroup.NoMemberAttributeException, CertificationCommand.FlushUnPersistedCommandsException, EmailException, LimitReassignmentException, SelfCertificationException, UnfinishedNativeIdentityChangeException

    public class GeneralException
extends sailpoint.tools.AbstractLocalizableException
    The base exception thrown by most IdentityIQ classes.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GeneralException()
      Construct an exception with no message or nested throwable.
      GeneralException(Message message)
      Creates an exception with a message that can be localized when rendered in the UI, rather than within the application.
      GeneralException(Message message, java.lang.Throwable t)
      Creates an exception with a message that can be localized when rendered in the UI, rather than within the application.
      GeneralException(java.lang.String message)
      Construct a new GeneralException with a detailed message.
      GeneralException(java.lang.String message, java.lang.Throwable t)
      Create a new GeneralException from an existing exception.
      GeneralException(java.lang.Throwable t)
      Construct a new GeneralException wrapping an existing exception.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GeneralException

        public GeneralException()
        Construct an exception with no message or nested throwable.

      • GeneralException

        public GeneralException(java.lang.String message)
        Construct a new GeneralException with a detailed message.

        NOTE: if this exception needs to display in the UI GeneralException(LocalizedMessage localizedMessage) should be used.

        Parameters:
        message - detail message

      • GeneralException

        public GeneralException(java.lang.String message,
                        java.lang.Throwable t)
        Create a new GeneralException from an existing exception.

        The existing exception will be embedded in the new one, but the new exception will have its own message.

      • GeneralException

        public GeneralException(java.lang.Throwable t)
        Construct a new GeneralException wrapping an existing exception.

        The existing exception will be embedded in the new one, and its message will become the default message for the GeneralException.

        Parameters:
        t - nested Throwable

      • GeneralException

        public GeneralException(Message message)
        Creates an exception with a message that can be localized when rendered in the UI, rather than within the application.
        Parameters:
        message - Localized message

      • GeneralException

        public GeneralException(Message message,
                        java.lang.Throwable t)
        Creates an exception with a message that can be localized when rendered in the UI, rather than within the application.
        Parameters:
        message - Localized message
        t - Exception to embed

    • Method Detail

      • enableBreakpoint

        public static void enableBreakpoint(boolean b)
        Enables or disables exception breakpoints.
        Parameters:
        b - true to enable breakpoint

      • checkBreakpoint

        public void checkBreakpoint()
        Called when exceptions are constructed.

        If breakpoints are enabled, call breakpoint(). This extra level is so tests can disable exception breakpoints when they are doing something that is known to produce an exception, but you do not want to stop the debugger.

      • breakpoint

        public void breakpoint()
        Called when an exception is constructed, and breakpoints are enabled. A handy place to set a debugger breakpoint. Added a bogus statement in the middle so we have something unambigous to break on and a reference to prevent compiler warnings.
